Structures on Moore spectra

Jun 30, 2019

This is a cute calculation which I figured would be good to write down. Consider the mod Moore spectrum . It is known that it does not admit a unital multiplication for . Moreover, it does not admit an -structure (see Example 3.3 here) by a Massey product argument. How about for ? We’ll show that it cannot admit an -structure as a Thom spectrum. Concretely: is the Thom spectrum of the map detecting , and the claim is that is not an -map.

To show this, we need the following theorem of Stasheff’s: a map of -spaces is an -map if and only if extends to a map of partial bar constructions. In our case, , and the partial bar construction is . In particular, if is an -map, we would obtain a factorization of through , so there would be a map detecting on the bottom cell of the source.

In order to prove that this cannot be the case, let us compose with the -local logarithm : this gives a map which detects . We first figure out the possibilities for our map . Recall (the Adams conjecture) that is the fiber of the map , where is a prime. Moreover, , where is the Bott element. In particular, our map is represented by a product which is invariant under for some .

If we assume that our polynomial satisfying can have rational coefficients, then it’s easy to do so: let be the image of under the quotient map .
